bibl.title: Thomas S. Brown and et al v. Thomas Jefferson Hamilton. Final Mittimus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: FINAL MITTIMUS United States of America, } ss. Territory of Washingtion, City of Seattle
The President of the United States of America to the Marshal of said Territory, and to the Keeper of the Jail of King County, in the Territory of Washington, Greeting:

Whereas, Thos. S. Brown has been arrested upon the oath of D.A. Carter for having, on or about the 10th day of October A.D. 1887, at _____ in the Territory aforesaid, Disobeyed the orders of the master of the American ships Ivanhoe

and has been examined by me, CHARLES D. EMERY a Commissioner of the United States for said Territory of Washington, upon the aforesaid charge, and has been required to give bail in the sum of $500.00/100 Dollars for ______ appearance before the District Court for the 3rd Judicial District of said Territory, on the first dayof the next regular term thereof, which requisition he ha_ failed to comply with:

These are, therefore, to Command you, In the name and by the authority of aforesaid, to receive the said Thos S. Brown prisoner__ of the United States of America, into your custody, to remain in confinement until_ he_ be dicharged by due course of law.
Given under my hand and seal in the City and Territory aforesaid, this 11th day of October A.D. 1887 (signed) C. D. Emery U.S. Commissioner.
In Re application of Thos S Brown etal for Habeas Corpus
body.ab: THE UNITED STATES of AMERICA vs. Thomas S. Brown
body.p: Received this MITTIMUS with the within named Prisoner, on the......day of............. A.D. 18....., and on the same day I committed the said Prisoner to the custody of the within named Jail Keeper, with whom I left at the same time a certified copy of this Mittimus. Dated...............18........ .................................... U.S. Marshal Washington Tex. By.................................Deputy.
In the matter of the application of Thomas S Brown et al for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
